etymologies: late 17th century: from French avocette, from Italian avosetta

definitions: a long-legged wading bird with a slender upturned bill and strikingly patterned plumage.

notes.text: Genus Recurvirostra, family Recurvirostridae: four species, including the American avocet (R. americana), which has black and white plumage

shortDefinitions: long-legged wading bird with slender upturned bill and strikingly patterned plumage
